That’s now considered a very uncool, even bigoted approach. The approach for the past 60 years has been:

“You are a member of Group A. Members of Group A tend to have characteristic X. That’s irrelevant to our relationship. I will treat you as an individual.”

I’d say this concept was a hard-fought battle that only entered mainstream society in the 1960s.

Before then, it was socially accepted to say:

“You are a member of Group A. Members of Group A tend to have characteristic X. I will treat you as if you have characteristic X.”
